{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is an adolescent school girl who complains of dropping objects from her hands. This symptom is suggestive of myoclonus, which is a sudden, brief, involuntary muscle jerk. The fact that the symptom is precipitated during the morning and during exams suggests that it may be stress-related. The patient also has a family history of epilepsy, as her cousin sister has been diagnosed with epilepsy. The EEG findings of epileptic spikes further support the diagnosis of epilepsy. Based on these findings, the most likely diagnosis is Juvenile myoclonic epilepsy.", "answer_choice": "A"}
